alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 4:49PM PST until January 15 at 3:52AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Navarro River at Navarro affecting Mendocino County. For the Navarro River...areas along highway 128...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin along portions of Highway 128 Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...Warning in effect through Sunday morning...Flooding to begin impacting areas of highway 128 early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM PST Friday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 25.9 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.9 feet on 01/17/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM PST.
